DOC.brief_summary: This study looks at how effective acid suppression therapy is on symptoms associated with chronic posterior laryngitis (CPL) in patients with documented pharyngeal acid reflux.
DOC.brief_title: Chronic Posterior Laryngitis With Suspected Laryngopharyngeal Reflux
DOC.criteria: One or more of the following symptoms present for at least 3 consecutive months: throat clearing, cough, globus, sore throat, or hoarseness. Patients must complete a runin diary card, and this will be looked at to ensure met the inclusion criteria. Must have a total score of 5 or more on the Chronic Posterior Laryngitis Index (CPLI) grading system. A number of diseases / conditions would preclude a patient from taking part in the study, as listed in the protocol. If the patient is on certain medications this will also preclude them from taking part.
